abstract.p: Mafalda Salvi letter on Jeffrey Rosen's April 30 article notes that, based on recent searches, her own Internet marketing profile would be incorrect1

block.p: Your article prompted me to take stock of my Internet use for the past year. I have searched topics on spinal stenosis for my 84-year-old neighbor, bought books on power tools and remodeling for my father, registered my cousin for a Krohn's disease newsletter and looked up information on snowboarding and ski resorts for my nephew. The way I see it, my Internet image is that of an 84-year-old woman with Krohn's disease and spinal stenosis who has an interest in power tools, remodeling and snowboarding. Good luck in targeting my purchasing habits.
